register.description: EMIF Revision Code and Status register

bitfield.description: EMIF Module ID
EMIF Major Revision Number
EMIF Minor Revision Number
Big Endian Specifies whether the EMIF is in big or little endian mode
Dual Clock Mode Specifies whether the vclk and mclk inputs are asynchronous
Fast Init Specifies whether EMIF fast initialization mode has been enabled
DDR PHY Ready Specifies whether the DDR PHY is ready for normal operation
Boot Unlock Set to 1 to change values of register fields that are affected by this bit.
DDR2 Termination resistor value. Set to 1 for 150 ohm, 0 for 75 ohm
DDR2 Enable Specifies whether the DDR2 mode has been enabled
Disable DLL select for DDR1 SDRAM Set to 1 to disable DLL inside DDR1 SDRAM
DDR SDRAM drive strength.
Double Rate Specifies whether the EMIF is set to operate at double or single data rate
SDRAM Enable. Define whether the SDRAM mode of the EMIF is enabled.
Timing unlock.

bitenum.description: Allowed to change values affected by this field

bitfield.description: SDRAM Data Bus Width Set to 1 when the system bus width to memory bus width is 2:1 for SDR SDRAM and 4:1 for DDR SDRAM A write to this field will cause the EMIF to start the SDRAM initialization sequence
CAS Latency A write to this field will cause the EMIF to start the SDRAM initialization sequence
Internal SDRAM Bank Setup Defines the number of banks inside the SDRAM connected
External SDRAM Bank Setup Defines whether the SDRAM bank accesses will use 1 or 2 chip select lines. A write to this field will cause the EMIF to start the SDRAM initialization sequence

bitenum.description: CS0 is used for SDRAM accesses
CS0 and CS1 are used for SDRAM accesses

bitfield.description: Page Size Defines the internal page size of the connected SDRAM devices
Self Refresh Writing a 1 to this bit will cause connected SDRAM devices to be placed into Self Refresh power-down mode and the EMIF to enter the Self-Refresh state
Error Detection 0: Disable error detection 1: Enable error detection

Refresh Rate Defines the rate at which EMIF refreshes the connected SDRAM devices. The refresh rate is the number of clock cycles required to cause a refresh interval for the appropriate SDRAM used SDRAM refresh rate = EMIF rate/ refresh rate where EMIF rate is equal to mclk rate Writing a value and#60; 0x0010 to this field will cause it to be loaded with the refresh_def_value
Specifies Trfc value of the SDRAM is minimum number of EMIF clock cycles from Refresh (REFR) or Load Mode (MRS) to Refresh (REFR) or Activate (ACTV) command, minus one TRFC = (Trfc / SDCLK) - 1
Specifies Trp value of the SDRAM is minimum number of EMIF cycles from Pre-charge to Active (ACTV) or Refresh (REFR/), minus one TRP = (Trp / SDCLK) - 1
Specifies Trcd value of the SDRAM is minimum number of EMIF cycles from Active (ACTV) to read (READ) or write (WRITE) command, minus one TRCD = (Trcd / SDCLK) - 1
Specifies Twr value of the SDRAM is minimum number of EMIF cycles from last write transfer to Precharge command, minus one TWR = (Twr / SDCLK) - 1
Specifies Tras value of the SDRAM in EMIF clock cycles from Activate (ACT) to Precharge command, minus one TRAS = (Tras / SDCLK) - 1
Specifies Trc value of the SDRAM is minimum number of EMIF clock cycles from Activate (ACT) to Activate (ACT) command, minus one TRC = (Trc / SDCLK) - 1
Specifies Trrd value of the SDRAM is minimum number of EMIF clock cycles from Activate (ACT) to Activate (ACT) command for a different bank, minus one TRRD = (Trrd / SDCLK) - 1
Specifies the minimum number of EMIF clock cycles from the last DDR write transfer to DDR read, minus one
Specified the minimum number of EMIF cycles minus one from ODT enable to write data driven. This field must be equal to (CAS latency -tAOND-1)
Specifies the minimum number of EMIF clock cycles minus one from self-fresh exit to any command (except READ).
Specifies the minimum number of EMIF clock cycles minus one from self-fresh exit to READ command.
Specifies the minimum number of EMIF clock cycles minus one from the last READ command to a Pre-Charge command.
Specifies the minimum number of EMIF clock cycles minus one for the pulse width of pad_mcke_o. This signal is used to put SDRAM devices in Self Refresh of Power Down.
Priority Raise Old Counter Specifies the number of memory bursts after which the EMIF raises the priority of old commands in the VBUSM Command FIFO
VBUSM data bus width. 0:32-bit 1:64-bit 2 and 3: Reserved
Write status FIFO depth.
Write FIFO depth
Command FIFO depth.
Async/Register read FIFO depth.
SDRAM read FIFO depth.
Read command FIFO depth.

32-bit counter that can be configured as specified in the Performance Counter Config Register and Performance Counter Master Region Select Register This register is used for performance monitoring and is cleared only on reset

32-bit counter that can be configured as specified in the Performance Counter Config Register and Performance Counter Master Region Select Register This register is used for performance monitoring and is cleared only on reset
Master ID filter enable for Performance Counter 2
Chip Select filter enable for Performance Counter 2
Filter configuration for Performance Counter 2

bitenum.description: Number of cycles VBUSM command fifo is full.
Number of cycles VBUSM write data fifo is full.
Number of cycles VBUSM read data fifo is full.
Number of cycles VBUSM write status fifo is full.
Number of cycles that a command was pending.

bitfield.description: Master ID filter enable for Performance Counter 1
Chip Select filter enable for Performance Counter 1
Filter configuration for Performance Counter 1

bitenum.description: Number of cycles VBUSM command fifo is full.
Number of cycles VBUSM write data fifo is full.
Number of cycles VBUSM read data fifo is full.
Number of cycles VBUSM write status fifo is full.
Number of cycles that a command was pending.

register.description: Performance Counter Master Region Select Register

bitfield.description: Master ID for Performance Counter 2
Chip Select for Performance Counter 2
Master ID for Performance Counter 1
Chip Select for Performance Counter 1

register.description: CS2 Config Register for Asynchronous Memory Access (ssel = 0)

bitfield.description: Sync SBSRAM/Asynchronous memory select Set to 1 to configure chip select for synchronous SBSRAM memory. The other fields in this register define the bits in the bank when SSEL is set to 0 (asynchronous memory mode)
Select Strobe mode Set to 1 if chip selects need to have write or read strobe timing
Select WE Strobe mode When set to 1, the pado_mdqm_o_n[7/3:0] output pins will act as active low byte enables when accessing chip select N
Extend Wait mode Set to 1 if extended asynchronous cycles are required based on padi_mwait_I

Wait Strobe Setup cycles Number of EMIF clock cycles from pado_ma_o, pado_mba_o, pad_d_o, pado_mdqm_o_n, and pado_mcs_o_n being set to pado_mwe_o_n asserted,minus one cycle.The reset value is 16 cycles
Wait Strobe Duration cycles Number of EMIF clock cycles for which pado_mwe_o_n is held active, minus one cycle

Wait Strobe Hold cycles Number of EMIF clock cycles for which pado_ma_o, pado_mba_o, pad_d_o, pado_mdqm_o_n, and pado_mcs_o_n are held after pado_mwe_o_n has been deasserted, minus one cycle. The reset value is 8 cycles
Read Strobe Setup cycles Number of EMIF clock cycles from pado_ma_o, pado_mba_o, pado_mdqm_o_n, and pado_mcs_o_n being set to pado_moe_o_n asserted, minus one cycle. The reset value is 16 cycles
Read Strobe Duration cycles Number of EMIF clock cycles for which pado_moe_o_n is held active, minus one cycle. The reset value is 64 cycles

Read Strobe Hold cycles Number of EMIF clock cycles for which pado_ma_o, pado_mba_o, pado_mdqm_o_n, and pado_mcs_o_n are held after pado_moe_o_n has been deasserted, minus one cycle. The reset value is 8 cycles
Asynchronous Bank Size Defines the width of the asynchronous bank's data bus, as follows

register.description: CS2 Config Register for Synchronous Burst SRAM Access (ssel = 1)

bitfield.description: Sync SBSRAM/Asynchronous memory select Set to 1 to configure chip select for synchronous SBSRAM memory. The other fields in this register define the bits in the bank when SSEL is set to 0 (asynchronous memory mode)

SBSRAM Bank Chip Select Extend. Defines the behavior of the pad_cs_o[n] pin associated with the SBSRAM bank, as follows 0: pad_cs_o[n] goes inactive after final command has been issued 1: pad_cs_o[n] goes active low when pado_moe_o_n goes active low and will stay active low until pado_moe_o_n is inactive.The pado_moe_o_n tining is controlled by the r_ltncy value for the SBSRAM bank. Used for synchronous FIFO reads

SBSRAM Bank Read Enable Mode Defines the behavior of the pado_mads_o_n signal when accessing the SBSRAM bank, as follows: 0: ADS mode.The pado_mads_o_n signal goes active low for reads and writes. A deselect command is issued by driving pado_mads_o_n active high after a command, if no new command is pending for the same bank. Used for SBSRAM and ZBT devices 1: Read enable mode. The pado_mads_o_n signal goes active low only for reads. No deselect command is issued. Used for FIFO interfaces
SBSRAM Bank Write Latency Defines the SBSRAM bank's write latency in clock cycles
SBSRAM Bank Read Latency Defines the SBSRAM bank's read latency in clock cycles, as follows:
SBSRAM Bank Size Defines width of the SBSRAM bank's data bus

register.description: CS3 Config Register for Asynchronous Memory Access (ssel = 0)

bitfield.description: Sync SBSRAM/Asynchronous memory select Set to 1 to configure chip select for synchronous SBSRAM memory. The other fields in this register define the bits in the bank when SSEL is set to 0 (asynchronous memory mode)
Select Strobe mode Set to 1 if chip selects need to have write or read strobe timing
Select WE Strobe mode When set to 1, the pado_mdqm_o_n[7/3:0] output pins will act as active low byte enables when accessing chip select N
Extend Wait mode Set to 1 if extended asynchronous cycles are required based on padi_mwait_I

Wait Strobe Setup cycles Number of EMIF clock cycles from pado_ma_o, pado_mba_o, pad_d_o, pado_mdqm_o_n, and pado_mcs_o_n being set to pado_mwe_o_n asserted,minus one cycle.The reset value is 16 cycles
Wait Strobe Duration cycles Number of EMIF clock cycles for which pado_mwe_o_n is held active, minus one cycle

Wait Strobe Hold cycles Number of EMIF clock cycles for which pado_ma_o, pado_mba_o, pad_d_o, pado_mdqm_o_n, and pado_mcs_o_n are held after pado_mwe_o_n has been deasserted, minus one cycle. The reset value is 8 cycles
Read Strobe Setup cycles Number of EMIF clock cycles from pado_ma_o, pado_mba_o, pado_mdqm_o_n, and pado_mcs_o_n being set to pado_moe_o_n asserted, minus one cycle. The reset value is 16 cycles
Read Strobe Duration cycles Number of EMIF clock cycles for which pado_moe_o_n is held active, minus one cycle. The reset value is 64 cycles

Read Strobe Hold cycles Number of EMIF clock cycles for which pado_ma_o, pado_mba_o, pado_mdqm_o_n, and pado_mcs_o_n are held after pado_moe_o_n has been deasserted, minus one cycle. The reset value is 8 cycles
Asynchronous Bank Size Defines the width of the asynchronous bank's data bus, as follows

register.description: CS3 Config Register for Synchronous Burst SRAM Access (ssel = 1)

bitfield.description: Sync SBSRAM/Asynchronous memory select Set to 1 to configure chip select for synchronous SBSRAM memory. The other fields in this register define the bits in the bank when SSEL is set to 0 (asynchronous memory mode)

SBSRAM Bank Chip Select Extend. Defines the behavior of the pad_cs_o[n] pin associated with the SBSRAM bank, as follows 0: pad_cs_o[n] goes inactive after final command has been issued 1: pad_cs_o[n] goes active low when pado_moe_o_n goes active low and will stay active low until pado_moe_o_n is inactive.The pado_moe_o_n tining is controlled by the r_ltncy value for the SBSRAM bank. Used for synchronous FIFO reads

SBSRAM Bank Read Enable Mode Defines the behavior of the pado_mads_o_n signal when accessing the SBSRAM bank, as follows: 0: ADS mode.The pado_mads_o_n signal goes active low for reads and writes. A deselect command is issued by driving pado_mads_o_n active high after a command, if no new command is pending for the same bank. Used for SBSRAM and ZBT devices 1: Read enable mode. The pado_mads_o_n signal goes active low only for reads. No deselect command is issued. Used for FIFO interfaces
SBSRAM Bank Write Latency Defines the SBSRAM bank's write latency in clock cycles
SBSRAM Bank Read Latency Defines the SBSRAM bank's read latency in clock cycles, as follows:
SBSRAM Bank Size Defines width of the SBSRAM bank's data bus

bitfield.description: Sync SBSRAM/Asynchronous memory select Set to 1 to configure chip select for synchronous SBSRAM memory. The other fields in this register define the bits in the bank when SSEL is set to 0 (asynchronous memory mode)
Select Strobe mode Set to 1 if chip selects need to have write or read strobe timing

Wait Strobe Setup cycles Number of EMIF clock cycles from pado_ma_o, pado_mba_o, pad_d_o, pado_mdqm_o_n, and pado_mcs_o_n being set to pado_mwe_o_n asserted,minus one cycle.The reset value is 16 cycles

Read Strobe Duration cycles Number of EMIF clock cycles for which pado_moe_o_n is held active, minus one cycle. The reset value is 64 cycles

Read Strobe Hold cycles Number of EMIF clock cycles for which pado_ma_o, pado_mba_o, pado_mdqm_o_n, and pado_mcs_o_n are held after pado_moe_o_n has been deasserted, minus one cycle. The reset value is 8 cycles
Asynchronous Bank Size Defines the width of the asynchronous bank's data bus, as follows

register.description: CS4 Config Register for Synchronous Burst SRAM Access (ssel = 1)

bitfield.description: Sync SBSRAM/Asynchronous memory select Set to 1 to configure chip select for synchronous SBSRAM memory. The other fields in this register define the bits in the bank when SSEL is set to 0 (asynchronous memory mode)

SBSRAM Bank Chip Select Extend. Defines the behavior of the pad_cs_o[n] pin associated with the SBSRAM bank, as follows 0: pad_cs_o[n] goes inactive after final command has been issued 1: pad_cs_o[n] goes active low when pado_moe_o_n goes active low and will stay active low until pado_moe_o_n is inactive.The pado_moe_o_n tining is controlled by the r_ltncy value for the SBSRAM bank. Used for synchronous FIFO reads

SBSRAM Bank Read Enable Mode Defines the behavior of the pado_mads_o_n signal when accessing the SBSRAM bank, as follows: 0: ADS mode.The pado_mads_o_n signal goes active low for reads and writes. A deselect command is issued by driving pado_mads_o_n active high after a command, if no new command is pending for the same bank. Used for SBSRAM and ZBT devices 1: Read enable mode. The pado_mads_o_n signal goes active low only for reads. No deselect command is issued. Used for FIFO interfaces
SBSRAM Bank Write Latency Defines the SBSRAM bank's write latency in clock cycles
SBSRAM Bank Read Latency Defines the SBSRAM bank's read latency in clock cycles, as follows:
SBSRAM Bank Size Defines width of the SBSRAM bank's data bus

register.description: CS5 Config Register for Asynchronous Memory Access (ssel = 0)

bitfield.description: Sync SBSRAM/Asynchronous memory select Set to 1 to configure chip select for synchronous SBSRAM memory. The other fields in this register define the bits in the bank when SSEL is set to 0 (asynchronous memory mode)
Select Strobe mode Set to 1 if chip selects need to have write or read strobe timing
Select WE Strobe mode When set to 1, the pado_mdqm_o_n[7/3:0] output pins will act as active low byte enables when accessing chip select N
Extend Wait mode Set to 1 if extended asynchronous cycles are required based on padi_mwait_I

Wait Strobe Setup cycles Number of EMIF clock cycles from pado_ma_o, pado_mba_o, pad_d_o, pado_mdqm_o_n, and pado_mcs_o_n being set to pado_mwe_o_n asserted,minus one cycle.The reset value is 16 cycles
Wait Strobe Duration cycles Number of EMIF clock cycles for which pado_mwe_o_n is held active, minus one cycle

Wait Strobe Hold cycles Number of EMIF clock cycles for which pado_ma_o, pado_mba_o, pad_d_o, pado_mdqm_o_n, and pado_mcs_o_n are held after pado_mwe_o_n has been deasserted, minus one cycle. The reset value is 8 cycles
Read Strobe Setup cycles Number of EMIF clock cycles from pado_ma_o, pado_mba_o, pado_mdqm_o_n, and pado_mcs_o_n being set to pado_moe_o_n asserted, minus one cycle. The reset value is 16 cycles
Read Strobe Duration cycles Number of EMIF clock cycles for which pado_moe_o_n is held active, minus one cycle. The reset value is 64 cycles

Read Strobe Hold cycles Number of EMIF clock cycles for which pado_ma_o, pado_mba_o, pado_mdqm_o_n, and pado_mcs_o_n are held after pado_moe_o_n has been deasserted, minus one cycle. The reset value is 8 cycles
Asynchronous Bank Size Defines the width of the asynchronous bank's data bus, as follows

register.description: CS5 Config Register for Synchronous Burst SRAM Access (ssel = 1)

bitfield.description: Sync SBSRAM/Asynchronous memory select Set to 1 to configure chip select for synchronous SBSRAM memory. The other fields in this register define the bits in the bank when SSEL is set to 0 (asynchronous memory mode)

SBSRAM Bank Chip Select Extend. Defines the behavior of the pad_cs_o[n] pin associated with the SBSRAM bank, as follows 0: pad_cs_o[n] goes inactive after final command has been issued 1: pad_cs_o[n] goes active low when pado_moe_o_n goes active low and will stay active low until pado_moe_o_n is inactive.The pado_moe_o_n tining is controlled by the r_ltncy value for the SBSRAM bank. Used for synchronous FIFO reads

SBSRAM Bank Read Enable Mode Defines the behavior of the pado_mads_o_n signal when accessing the SBSRAM bank, as follows: 0: ADS mode.The pado_mads_o_n signal goes active low for reads and writes. A deselect command is issued by driving pado_mads_o_n active high after a command, if no new command is pending for the same bank. Used for SBSRAM and ZBT devices 1: Read enable mode. The pado_mads_o_n signal goes active low only for reads. No deselect command is issued. Used for FIFO interfaces
SBSRAM Bank Write Latency Defines the SBSRAM bank's write latency in clock cycles
SBSRAM Bank Read Latency Defines the SBSRAM bank's read latency in clock cycles, as follows:
SBSRAM Bank Size Defines width of the SBSRAM bank's data bus
Wait Polarity Defines the polarity of the padpadi_mwait_i port, as follows: 0: Wait if padpadi_mwait_i port is low 1: Wait if padpadi_mwait_i port is high

Turn Around cycles Number of EMIF clock cycles between the end of one asynchronous bank access and the start of another asynchronous bank access, minus one cycle. This delay is not incurred between a read followed by a read, or a write followed by a write to the same bank. The reset value is 4 cycles
Maximum External Wait cycles The value in this field defines the number of 16 EMIF cycle periods the EMIF will wait for an extended asynchronous cycle before the cycle is terminated

Line Trap Set to 1 by hardware to indicate illegal memory access type or invalid cache line size. Writing a 1 will clear this bit as well as the lt_masked bit in the Interrupt Masked register. Writing a 0 has no effect

Parity Error Set to 1 by hardware to indicate a parity error during SDRAM access. Writing a 1 will clear this bit as well as the pe_masked bit in the Interrupt Masked register. Writing a 0 has no effect

Asynchronous Timeout Set to 1 by hardware to indicate that during an extended asynchronous bank access cycle, the padi_mwait_i signal did not go inactive within the number of cycles defined by the max_ext_wait field in Async Wait Cycle Config register. Writing a 1 will clear this bit as well as the at_masked bit in the Interrupt Masked register. Writing a 0 has no effect

Masked Line Trap Set to 1 by hardware to indicate illegal memory access type or invalid cache line size. Writing a 1 will clear this bit as well as the lt bit in the Interrupt Raw register. Writing a 0 has no effect
Masked Parity Error Set to 1 by hardware to indicate a parity error during SDRAM access. Writing a 1 will clear this bit as well as the pe bit in the Interrupt Raw register. Writing a 0 has no effect

Masked Asynchronous Timeout Set to 1 by hardware to indicate that during an extended asynchronous bank access cycle, the padi_mwait_i signal did not go inactive within the number of cycles defined by the max_ext_wait field in Async Wait Cycle Config register. Writing a 1 will clear this bit as well as the at bit in the Interrupt Raw register. Writing a 0 has no effect

Line Trap Mask Set Bit Writing a 1 in this bit field will enable the interrupt and set this bit in the Line Trap Mask bit field of the Interrupt Mask Clear Register. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 into this bit field
Parity Error Mask Set Bit Writing a 1 will enable the interrupt, and set this bit as well as the pe_mask_clr bit in the Interrupt Mask Clear register. Writing a 0 has no effect

Asynchronous Timeout Mask Set Bit Writing a 1 in this bit field will enable the interrupt and set this bit in the Asynchronous Timeout Mask Clear bit field of the Interrupt Mask Register. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 into this bit field

Line Trap Mask Clear Bit Writing a 1 in this bit field will disable the interrupt and clear this bit in the Line Trap Mask Set bit field of the Interrupt Mask Register. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 into this bit field. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Parity Error Mask Clear Bit Writing a 1 will disable the interrupt, and clear this bit as well as the pe_mask_set bit in the Interrupt Mask Set register. Writing a 0 has no effect

Asynchronous Timeout Mask Clear Bit Writing a 1 in this bit field will disable the interrupt and clear this bit in the Asynchronous Timeout Mask Set bit field of the Interrupt Mask Register. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 into this bit field. Writing a 0 has no effect

register.description: DDR PHY ID and Revision Register

bitfield.description: This register specifies the module ID and revision of the DDR PHY being used The bit field definitions are DDR PHY specific and should be described in the DDR PHY specification
This register is used to control the DDR PHY The bit field definitions are DDR PHY specific and should be described in the DDR PHY specifications
This register is used to monitor the status of the DDR PHY The bit field definitions are DDR PHY specific and should be described in the DDR PHY specifications
This register is used to control the IOs such as the VTP calibration of the IOs.
This register is used to monitor the status of the IOs such as the VTP calibration of the IOs.
